description: From Middle English snelly, snellych, snellik, snellich, from Old English snellīċe (“rapidly, quickly, with activity”), from snellīċ (“moving quickly; swift”), equivalent to snell +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: snelly (comparative more snelly, superlative most snelly)

entries.meaning: (UK dialectal, Northern England, Scotland) quickly; sharply; acutely; coldly
examples: The snaw drives snelly through the dale.

entries.meaning: (UK dialectal, Northern England, Scotland, in speech) sharply; severely; tartly; curtly
